subject: Politics
title: The Social Contract
description: A fast breakdown of The Social Contract for builders.

hook.text: You never signed a contract with the government. Yet you obey its laws. The social contract explains why.

buildup.text: Social contract theory says government authority comes from an agreement among citizens to live under shared rules.

discovery.text: Hobbes said life without government is 'nasty, brutish, and short.' People trade freedom for security.

twist.text: Locke disagreed. Government must protect natural rights. If it fails, people can overthrow it.

climax.text: Rousseau went further. The social contract must reflect the 'general will' â€” the true interest of all citizens.

punchline.text: The social contract is imaginary. Its consequences are completely real.

quiz.question: According to Locke, when can people overthrow their government?
options: When the government fails to protect natural rights
